Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different habitats, both on land (e.g., gardens, forests) and in water (e.g., ponds, lakes).
The student can represent different kinds of plants found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, and bushes.
The student can depict various animals living in each habitat, such as squirrels, lizards, ants, fish, and birds.
The student can demonstrate comparisons by showing how the types of living things vary across different habitats.
The student can observe and draw patterns in the diversity of plants and animals across different habitats.
